content: Savings General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 29 Aug 2018What is the list of passive income options in Singapore?Some work for money. Some make money work for them. ... I want money to be my slave. To be the Worshipful Master of my own money.If you have any passive income to share, please feel free to comment!:)2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 12 Sep 2019For true passive income that requires very little or no maintenance work, you don't have much choice. 1) stock dividends.2) royalty from creative works such as books, music, arts.3) advertisement from internet creative works2 and 3 are not easy for most folks. And even these 2 tend to dwindle in time due to lack of publicity.I exclude property (one popular "passive income" of Singapore) because it is really not passive. There is maintenance involved. Any time an issue pops up, your tenants are going to call you up for piping, electricity, carpeting, door windows issue etc.You probably need to get new tenants now and then and check on stuff.Probably semi-passive?I do options trading and I count that as semi-passive income too. You still have to check the portfolio every 1 week or so and renew expiring trades to get the stream of income.Passive income is not as easy as sold in stories and books.0 comments2
